intro: Gaya gaudichaudiana var. hirsutula, commonly known as the hairy gaya, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with a hairy texture, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. It is native to Southeast Asia and thrives in moist, tropical environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
